properties.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued January 5 at 9:03PM PST until January 6 at 10:00PM PST by NWS Spokane WA
properties.description:
...MODERATE TO HEAVY SNOW MONDAY AND MONDAY NIGHT FOR THE
CASCADES...NORTHEAST WASHINGTON...BLUE MOUNTAINS... AND THE IDAHO
PANHANDLE...

.Bands of snow showers will impact the Cascades and Idaho Panhandle
overnight impacting travel over the passes.  A stronger storm arrives
Monday morning with snow expanding into many areas of Eastern
Washington and North Idaho.  Moderate to heavy snow accumulations
are expected.  Snow will transition to rain for the Palouse and
Spokane - Coeur D Alene Areas by Monday afternoon.

* WHAT...Additional 3 to 6 inches through tonight near the
Cascade Crest. An additional 1 to 2 feet of heavy wet snow
expected in the mountains near the Cascade crest Monday and
Monday evening. Valley snow accumulations of 6 to 11 inches
for upper portions of Wenatchee River Valley and the upper
Methow Valley including Plain, Lake Wenatchee, and Mazama.

* WHERE...The Cascade Crest including Highway 2 from Coles
Corner to Stevens Pass, Plain, Lake Wenatchee, and Mazama.

* WHEN...For the Winter Weather Advisory, through 4 AM PST
Monday. For the Winter Storm Warning, from 4 AM to 10 PM PST
Monday.

* IMPACTS...Winter driving conditions are expected through
tonight with periods of moderate to heavy mountain snow.
Increasingly heavy snow will have the potential to produce
dangerous conditions Monday into Monday evening with snowfall
rates up to 3 inches per hour.

* ADDITIONAL DETAILS...The Northwest Avalanche Center has issued a
backcountry avalanche warning for the Stevens Pass Area.  Those with
interest in the backcountry should consult with the avalanche center
message at https://www.nwac.us for additional information.  The warning
is for backcountry terrain only and does not apply to highways or ski
areas.
properties.instruction:
If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in
your vehicle in case of an emergency.

Slow down and use caution while traveling.

The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can
be obtained by calling 5 1 1.

NWSheadline: WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 AM PST MONDAY... ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 4 AM TO 10 PM PST MONDAY FOR THE CASCADE CREST INCLUDING HIGHWAY 2 BETWEEN COLES CORNER AND STEVENS PASS
